MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.IList CacheVaryByHeaders { get; }
.property instance class System.Collections.IList CacheVaryByHeaders

Docs.summary: Returns a list of any additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: A list of any additional HTTP headers by which caching is varied.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> classes inherit this property from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IPageAdapter> interface. These implementations return `null`.
For more information, see the "Output Caching" section in [Mobile Text Writer Rendering Best Practices](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/28893297-2c45-4c57-a2b3-9cdd5898f988).

.property instance class System.Collections.IDictionary CookielessDataDictionary

Docs.summary: Gets or sets persisted data between requests through the use of the URL query string. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: Data persisted between requests through the use of the URL query string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is populated when a valid <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> type is configured as an attribute of the `< mobileControls >` configuration element.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection DeterminePostBackMode (System.Web.HttpRequest request, string postEventSourceID, string postEventArgumentID, System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection baseCollection);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection DeterminePostBackMode(class System.Web.HttpRequest request, string postEventSourceID, string postEventArgumentID, class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection baseCollection) cil managed

Docs.param: A object that contains request information, such as HTTP headers.
Collection of postback data from the request object.
Docs.summary: Called to determine the postback data collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: A modified version of the parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Because some devices handle postback differently from others, this method allows the adapter to modify the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> implementations of this method gather control data if the post originated from a different page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ChtmlPageAdapter> implementation performs CHTML-specific handling of postback data.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool DeviceQualifies (System.Web.HttpContext context);
.method public static hidebysig bool DeviceQualifies(class System.Web.HttpContext context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Evaluates whether the device adapter set applies to the specified request. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: if the device adapter set applies to the specified request; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks
|Class|Returns|Preferred rendering type|Check value of JavaScript property| |-----------|-------------|------------------------------|----------------------------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter>|`true`|Checks whether the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> property is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeHtml32> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeChtml10>.|The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.JavaScript%2A> property returns `true`.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.ChtmlPageAdapter>|`true`|Checks whether the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> property is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeHtml32> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeChtml10>.|The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.JavaScript%2A> property's device capability returns false.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter>|`true`|Checks whether the value of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.HttpCapabilitiesBase.PreferredRenderingType%2A> property is <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeWml11> or <xref:System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities.PreferredRenderingTypeWml12>.|Not applicable.|

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual string EventArgumentKey { get; }
.property instance string EventArgumentKey

Docs.summary: Returns the key to use to submit the event argument. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The key to use to submit the event argument.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If an inheriting adapter overrides this property, it must also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method to process the postback.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual string EventSourceKey { get; }
.property instance string EventSourceKey

Docs.summary: Returns the key to use to submit the event source. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The key to use to submit the event source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If an inheriting adapter overrides this property, it must also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.DeterminePostBackMode%2A> method to process the postback.

MemberSignature.Value: public string GetFormUrl (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form form);
.method public hidebysig instance string GetFormUrl(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form form) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a URL that can be used to uniquely identify the form. This URL must only be passed as a parameter to the method of the text writer. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: A URL that can be used to uniquely identify the form.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool HandleError (Exception e, System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandleError(class System.Exception e, class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.summary: Called if an unhandled exception occurs during the life cycle of the page. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An adapter can choose to handle the exception and render an error message. The method returns `true` if it handles the error.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter> class, this implementation does nothing and returns `false`.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> class, this implementation formats the error for WML and returns `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool HandlePagePostBackEvent (string eventSource, string eventArgument);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool HandlePagePostBackEvent(string eventSource, string eventArgument) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns if it handles the exception. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Called during postback. Allows a page adapter to handle a postback event by itself.
Both the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.HandlePagePostBackEvent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter.HandlePagePostBackEvent%2A> methods return false.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual bool IsFormRendered (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form form);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsFormRendered(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form form) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns whether or not the specified form is to be rendered as part of the current request. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.returns: if the specified form is to be rendered as part of the current request; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter> class, only the active form is rendered for each request.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPageAdapter> class, multiple forms can be combined as cards into a single deck, if size permits.

Docs.value: The page weight, based on the device's screen size, which is appropriate for the target device.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the page to which the adapter is attached. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: The page associated with the device adapter.

MemberSignature.Value: public bool PersistCookielessData { get; set; }
.property instance bool PersistCookielessData

Docs.summary: Sets or returns whether items from the property are persisted in the query string. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Docs.value: if items from the property are persisted in the query string; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default this value is `true` if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlPageAdapter.CookielessDataDictionary%2A> entry in the `MobileControls` configuration section of Web.config is set to a valid dictionary type.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void RenderPostBackEvent (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer, string target, string argument);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RenderPostBackEvent(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer, string target, string argument) cil managed

Docs.summary: Renders a reference to a postback event appropriately for the target device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks On script-capable devices, the event is rendered as a call to a script function. On other devices, the event is rendered as a URL.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void RenderPostBackHeader (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form form);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RenderPostBackHeader(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer, class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form form) cil managed

Docs.param: The unique identifier for the form.
Docs.summary: Renders the header associated with postbacks. For browsers that support script, this includes a script block to perform postback. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Called by the form adapter.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void RenderUrlPostBackEvent (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer, string target, string argument);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void RenderUrlPostBackEvent(class System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.HtmlMobileTextWriter writer, string target, string argument) cil managed

Docs.summary: Renders a reference to a postback event, as a URL. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Postbacks rendered as a URL do not submit dynamic form data, such as text-box contents, on postback. To submit such data on postback on devices that do not support script, use an HTML `submit` button instead.
